intro: Psychotria subglabra, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Psychotria subglabra is also noted for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential pharmacological applications.
